snippet: Twelve House Republicans did not vote for John A. Boehner's re-election as speaker. Is that really so bad? Judging by recent history, it is.
abstract: Twelve House Republicans did not vote for John A. Boehner's re-election as speaker. Is that really so bad? Judging by recent history, it is.

headline.main: Were the G.O.P. Votes Against Boehner a Historic Rejection?
headline.print_headline: A Small but Significant Number of Defections in the Vote on Boehner as Speaker
